oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Price Memorial AME Zion: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Price Memorial African Methodist Episcopal Zion

Color photograph of church facade facing Dooley Street. Brick church features a double door, glass entrance and central, brick steps. Stained glass windows flank the entrance. A half-round, stained glass window also appears above the doorway. A cross constructed out of glass panes adorns the top of the facade. A window, round topped with extended legs, appears on on the outlying side of each lower stained glass window. Three cornerstones are set into the brickwork of the facade's bottom right. A enclosed tower with a cross emblem and steeple juts from the roof's ridge.

Price Memorial AME Zion's current church building dates to 1981. It sits in close proximity to several African American churches. At the time of fieldwork (June 22, 1998), J.T. Holmes served as pastor.
